author: adityapatwardhan
body:
## PR Summary

GitHub needs TLS1.2. Invoke-WebRequest defaults do not support TLS1.2 and hence code coverage runs are blocked as they cannot get artifacts from GitHub. 

This PR adds in the workaround to change the SecurityProtocol to add TLS1.2

Also added `-ErrorAction SilentlyContinue` so it does not throw a non-terminating error when `pwsh.exe` is not found.

comments.author: markekraus
comments.body:
Hmm... I think we should look at add this more globally. I was under the impression that Start-PSBootstrap would be run in all of the CIs before any commands and we wouldn't need to make this change in every location. One the recent PRs should have addresses this. 

If we have a common entry point for all activities in all environments, we should make this setting change there. perhaps setting it during import of build.psm1? 

Separate issue: consider a patch to Windows PowerShell 5.1 to enable TLS 1.1 and TLS 1.2 by default.

comments.author: adityapatwardhan
comments.body:
@markekraus This particular script does not run in CI, but a different test machine as the execution time for code coverage runs exceeds CI run time limits. 

Also, this script does not use `Start-PSBootstrap` as it does not build PowerShell but uses the packages generated by AppVeyor nightly build.

title: Add TLS1.2 workaround for code coverage script
